html file's preferences' page . it doesn't like the images in site

Created an attachment (id=24305)
no effect in editor

Since myself (and others) seem to get it to work (and I just checked the two
specific cases you mention) ... I suspect something has gone drasticlly wrong
with your install. 

You did install "on top" of Eclipse 3.1, right? (not 3.01 or an early version of
Eclipse 3.1?). 

You might try a fresh install of 3.1 (in a new directory), WTP's prereqs as
listed on WTP download page, and WTP itself. 

If you have trouble after that, please attach to this bug your configuration and
error log (available from Help-->About box) and I'll continue to try and figure
it out with you.

Created an attachment (id=24362)
wtp requirement

it seems that it can use eclipse release 3.1.
but it can't work.

I change eclipse to 3.1R4 . it still can't work.

Let's start with fundamentals ... according to your pasted image, you may have
downloaded the eclipse 3.1 package for linux? But you are on windows? 

If not that, please attach configuration, as mentioned in comment #3. 

Thanks,

I 've download the newest WTP.

run eclipse -clean

there are still errors.

Created an attachment (id=24412)
preferences
What happens if you remove the Hibernate tools?

after remove the Hibernate tools, it works well.

thank you.

but there is a regret that its jsp editor can't work like lomboz.

I want that it can auto prompt custom's jsp tags and any classes' method in 
<%....%>.

is it possible?  is it implement that?

a question:

when I edit html source. I found that it can't prompt the attributes of the 
elements.

is it not implements yet?

The Hibernate tools contain an older and incompatible snapshot of *some* of WTP
which conflicts with the version of WTP you're trying to work with.

The '.' key should already auto-prompt for content assist in Java code
areas--maybe it's just taking a little too long to generate the proposals.  HTML
content assist should be available as well--do the attributes themselves not
show up or are you not getting the expected proposals for values?  Does the
Properties view show you all of the available attributes for those HTML tags?

thanks.

you mean that I 've to use Properties view.

it didn't surpport auto-prompt for the available attributes of HTML tags.

jsp editor didn't surpport auto-prompt for custom tags and java codes, did it?

No, I'm not saying you have to use the Properties view, I meant that it will
show you the same options as Content Assist.  The auto-activation of Content
Assist is controllable in your Preferences, but the default should be for them
all to be "on".

thanks.

I add a space to the prefrences for prompt the attributes.

it runs well now.

the lastest two question on using JSP editor: 
1) does it surpport auto-prompt custom tags like struts or webwork 's tags?
2) does it surpport auto-prompt in JSP scriptlet?

I found a problem. it seems a bug:

it can prompt the attributes in HTML editor but it can't do in JSP editor.

in JSP editor I can also only use properties view.

Are there any bugs left here? 

creatxr, ... typcially better to open seperate bugzillas for seperate bugs ...
I'm a little confused by this one and not sure if there's anything left for us
to do?
Changing abstract to be at least a little more accurate.

Marking as WORKSFORME pending a response.  Testing with the latest code, Content
Assist works find for HTML and for custom tag attributes in JSP files.  HTML tag
attributes in JSP files are duplicated, but that's a separate known bug.

I use the lastest version now . It no longer has the problem.

but I don't know why eclipse often occupy more than 95% CPU .
I use eclipse since version 3.0 , but the problem has no change.
I don't remember that if I've posted the problem in other topic.

my laptop: cpu centrino 1.73G memory 1G
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
